intro: Kaunia gynoximorpha, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and ease of care.
